SEARCH

All Classes and Interfaces

Class
Description
Board
The Board class represents the game board and contains methods for manipulating and querying the board state.
BoardPanel
BoardPanel represents the game board UI and handles user interactions with the game.
Client
The Client class manages the connection to the game server and handles communication between the client and server, including sending and receiving game states.
CommonMethods
CommonMethods is a utility class that provides common UI methods for creating and configuring buttons for main menu and sub menu.
ComplexMove
Represents a push/pull move in the game.
CountdownTimer
CountdownTimer is a thread-based timer that counts down from a specified number of minutes.
Directions
Enum representing the four main directions: North, South, Left, and Right.
GameControllerPanel
GameControllerPanel displays information about current turn and controls for individual moves.
GameLawsTest
GameLawsTest: Provides 5 JUnit tests for checking if rules where implemented correctly.
GameListener
Interface for game event listeners.
GameMode
Enum representing the different game modes in the application.
GameModel
Represents the model for the game, containing the game logic and state.
GameModePanel
GameModePanel is the panel displayed when selecting any of game modes.
GameState
Represents the state of the game at a particular point in time.
GameView
GameView class is responsible for managing the game window and handling game-related actions.
Launcher
Launcher class to start the game application.
Loader
Loader class to handle loading game states from a file.
Move
Abstract class representing a move in the game.
MoveDirections
Interface for determining the direction of a move.
Offset2D
Represents a 2D offset or position on the board.
Player
Represents a player in the game.
PlayingSide
Enum representing the playing side of a player in the game.
ReplayControllerPanel
ReplayControllerPanel allows users to control the replay of a previously saved game.
RulesPanel
RulesPanel displays the rules of the game and credits.
Saver
Saver class to handle saving game states to a file.
Server
The Server class manages connections to clients and handles communication between them.
StepMove
Represents a simple step move in the game.
Tile
Represents a tile on the game board, which can contain a troop and a player.
Troop
Represents a troop in the game.
TroopType
Enum representing different types of troops in the game, each with a specific strength and name.
WelcomePanel
The WelcomePanel class represents the initial welcome screen for the game.
